intro: Heterocrambe aristidis, commonly known as the aristid's heterocrambe, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branched stems and hairy leaves. Its small, four-petaled flowers are usually pale yellow or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. The seeds are enclosed in siliques, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family.
